_header: Lady for Thy Son sake / Save me fro the fiends black
Subjects: dialogues, death and man; Virgin Mary, as speaker in debate
_description: Dialogue between a dying person, Death, the Fiend, an Angel, the Virgin Mary, Christ, and God

BLSto39.First Lines:
Þis saule chalenge I for to wynne þat is full of dedly
                    synneI hafe foght þe many a day for to take þe to my
                    pray…
BLSto39.Last Lines:
…ffor þis þe sonke in þi childhede Son forgyf him
                    his mysdedeSon als þou biddes so sal it be Nothyng I will denye
                    ye
BLSto39.Note:
Two verse lines contained in each scroll in the manuscript
                    illustration.
